text.text_translated: In 2010, NASA's team that protects Earth from space objects recognized and recorded 90% of the asteroids near Earth that were 1km wide. These are called 'near-Earth objects' (NEOs), which are as big as mountains and are found within 50 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA still needs to find about 50 more. However, NASA knows about 887 NEOs, and the agency says that none of these are a significant danger to the planet.

best_attempt.text_translated: In 2010, NASA's planetary defence team identified and logged 90% of the asteroids near Earth, which were 1km wide. These are called 'near-Earth objects' (NEOs), which are objects close to Earth that are as big as mountains and include anything within 50 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. With an estimated 50 more to log, NASA says that none of the 887 NEOs it knows about are a significant danger to the planet.
